TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {1249=Edward B. Marks founded the firm in 1919 with the purchase of J. Stern & Co. Marks bought out George M. Cohan in 1967. The current importance of Marks is mostly in his being USA agent for PWM and Josef Weinberger, but the firm publishes just about every kind of music, including works by Bolcom and Sessions.}
textBeforeTable: Plate Numbers Imprints, Agencies, Addresses Editions Edward B. Marks founded the firm in 1919 with the purchase of J. Stern & Co. Marks bought out George M. Cohan in 1967. The current importance of Marks is mostly in his being USA agent for PWM and Josef Weinberger, but the firm publishes just about every kind of music, including works by Bolcom and Sessions.
